terms.description:
Description:
 Type of charge point providing slower charging speeds, typically used in home, workplace, or public locations. 
 

 Usage rules:
 • Always write “AC” in uppercase.
 • Use in full expressions such as “AC charge point” for clarity.
 • Do not translate the acronym in localized content.
 • Avoid using “alternating current” unless in technical or educational documentation.
 • Acceptable in both UI and documentation when describing charger type or specifications.
 
 Platform: Hub, Charge
 Audience: B2B and B2C

Description: Refers to a user’s Monta account in the app or portal, containing personal, billing, and team-related data. Not related to financial or bank accounts.

Usage rules:
• Use lowercase in running text (“your account”).
• Capitalize only when part of a UI label, menu item, or title (e.g., Account Settings, My Account).
• Avoid ambiguous use, such as “bank account” or “user account,” unless necessary for clarity.
• Use consistently across all Monta products to refer to the user’s Monta profile, not external systems.

Platform: Hub, Charge, Control
Audience: B2B and B2C

Description: An extra fee added to a price group by a Team Owner to adjust session pricing. Examples include start fee, charging fee, minute fee, and idle fee. Used to manage and fine-tune pricing behavior for charging sessions.

Usage rules:
• Use additional fee in lowercase in running text.
• Do not abbreviate or shorten.
• Avoid using interchangeably with price or tariff - these refer to separate pricing structures.
• Use consistently when describing extra costs applied on top of a base rate in Hub.

Platform: Hub
Audience: B2B

Description: A user role in Monta Hub with full access to account management, permissions, and organizational configurations for Business plan users. 

Usage rules:
• Capitalize Admin when referring to the specific user role (e.g., Admin role).
• Use lowercase (admin) when referring to a person performing the role in running text.
• Use consistently in Hub to describe users with full organizational access and control permissions.

Platform: Hub
Audience: B2B

Description: A French government incentive program that supports the installation and expansion of EV charging infrastructure across France. Advenir provides financial aid to promote the adoption of electric mobility.

Usage rules:
• Keep the name Advenir in French; do not translate or localize.
• Always use Title Case (Advenir).

Platform: Hub
Audience: B2B

Description: Acronym for Alternative Fuels Infrastructure Regulation, an EU regulation that establishes binding targets for the deployment of EV charging and refueling infrastructure across member states.

Usage rules:
• Always write in all caps: AFIR.
• On first mention, spell out the full name followed by the acronym in parentheses - Alternative Fuels Infrastructure Regulation (AFIR).
• Use the acronym alone (AFIR) after the first mention.
• Do not pluralize or translate.
• Use only in regulatory, compliance, or policy-related contexts relevant to EU infrastructure standards.

Platform: Hub
Audience: B2B

Description: A system-generated notification that informs operators about important operational or device-related events, such as errors, outages, or failed charges. Alerts are automatically triggered when specific conditions or thresholds are met.

Usage rules:
• Use alert in lowercase in running text.
• Capitalize only when part of a UI label, menu item, or title (e.g., Alert Settings, New Alert).
• Do not use interchangeably with notification - alert refers to automated, event-driven system messages, while notification may include general updates or communications.
• Use consistently in contexts describing system logic, monitoring, or operator responses.

Platform: Hub
Audience: B2B

Description: A configuration feature that allows users to organize and manage alerts for charge points, charging sites, or teams. Alert groups ensure that the appropriate people are notified when specific incidents or conditions occur.

Usage rules:
• Use alert group in lowercase in running text.
• Capitalize when referring to the feature name or in UI contexts (e.g., Alert Groups, Create Alert Group).
• Avoid using interchangeably with notification group or team alerts, alert group refers specifically to system-triggered operational events.
• Use only in contexts describing monitoring, alert management, or incident response settings.

Platform: Hub
Audience: B2B

Description: An EU regulation that sets mandatory targets for member states to deploy accessible and interoperable alternative fuel infrastructure, including EV charging and refuelling stations. It aims to support the transition to sustainable mobility across the EU.

Usage rules:
• Use the full name Alternative Fuels Infrastructure Regulation on first mention, followed by the acronym in parentheses - Alternative Fuels Infrastructure Regulation (AFIR).
• Use AFIR alone in subsequent mentions.
• Keep capitalization exactly as in the official title.
• Do not translate or abbreviate further.
• Use only in contexts related to compliance, infrastructure deployment, or EU regulatory standards.

Platform: Hub
Audience: B2B

terms.description: Monta’s Public API allows end customers to integrate their Monta-connected charge points and EVs with any system to use the data. For example, triggering a home charge based on conditions like house meter or solar energy

Description: A unique identifier used to authenticate and validate a client’s identity when sending requests to the Monta API. It ensures secure communication between systems and prevents unauthorized access.

Usage rules:
• Always lowercase “key.” Write as “API key” (not “API Key”).
• Do not translate or localize the term “API.”
• Use the singular form unless referring to multiple credentials.
• Suitable for technical or developer-facing content only; avoid in consumer-facing copy.

Platform: Hub, Control
Audience: B2B

Description: Lightweight Apple experience that lets iOS drivers start a charge or complete a quick action in Monta Charge without installing the full app.

Usage rules:
• Use “App Clips” (Apple’s official term).
• Translatable: Partial - FR Extrait d’app, FR_CA Extrait d’appli.
• Keep capitalization: Both words capitalized.
• Mention only when the experience differs from the full app.
• Do not equate with Shortcuts, Widgets, or Instant Apps.
• For Android, reference the equivalent “Instant Apps.”

Platform: Charge
Audience: B2C

Description: Apple’s digital marketplace for downloading and updating iOS and iPadOS applications, including the Monta Charge app.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Keep capitalization as “App Store.”
 • Do not translate or modify.
 • Use the definite article when referring to it (“on the App Store”).
 

 Platform: Charge
 Audience: B2C

Description: Automatic top-up feature in the wallet > Refill section that adds funds when the balance reaches a defined threshold. Users can set the trigger amount and refill value.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use lowercase.
 • Always written as “auto refill” (two words).
 • Use consistently with feature name in UI and documentation.
 

 Platform: Charge
 Audience: B2C

Description: Automatic monthly transfer feature in the wallet > Withdraw section that moves available funds to a linked bank account.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Capitalize only the first word in UI contexts (“Auto withdrawal”).
 • Keep phrasing consistent with the in-app label.
 

 Platform: Charge
 Audience: B2C

Description: Monta feature that automatically starts a charging session when a registered EV is plugged into a compatible charge point.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use sentence case for stand alone UI labels, beginning of the sentence. use lower case when in the running texts.
 • Avoid short form auto, as it implies “car”
 • Use only for describing this specific B2C feature.
 

 Platform: Charge
 Audience: B2C

Description: Remote collection of data from an electricity meter, where consumption data is recorded and made accessible to the service provider for monitoring and reporting.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use lowercase.
 • Prefer “automatic reading” over “auto reading.”
 • Avoid abbreviations or rephrasing.
 

 Platform: Hub, Control
 Audience: B2B

Description: Feature that enables a charge to begin automatically when an EV is plugged into a private charge point configured for AutoStart. Used in private and closed networks.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use sentence case for stand alone UI labels, beginning of the sentence. Use lower case when in the running texts.
 • Avoid short form auto, as it implies “car”
 • Use only for describing this specific B2C feature
 

 Platform: Charge, Hub
 Audience: B2C

Description: Status indicating that a charge point is online, connected, and ready for use.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use lowercase in text.
 • In UI, display as “Available” (Title Case).
 • Use only for charge point availability, not for pricing or feature readiness.
 

 Platform: Charge, Hub
 Audience: B2B and B2C

Description: The available amount of money in a user’s wallet within Monta, representing funds available for charging or withdrawals.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use lowercase in text.
 • In UI, display as “Balance.”
 

 Platform: Charge, Hub
 Audience: B2B and B2C

Description: The total amount of electrical energy a battery can store and deliver, typically measured in ampere-hours (Ah) or watt-hours (Wh). It represents the battery’s total storage potential.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use lowercase.
 • Prefer concise form (e.g., “battery capacity: 60 kWh”).
 • Use only in technical or informative contexts.
 

 Platform: Charge, Hub
 Audience: B2B and B2C

Description: Field label showing the current battery percentage of an integrated vehicle, for example “Battery level: 78%.”
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use Title Case in UI (“Battery level”).
 • Always express value as a percentage.
 • Avoid synonyms like “charge level.”
 

 Platform: Charge, Hub
 Audience: B2C, B2B

Description: Monta Hub feature allowing operators to define and manage price agreements and access terms with eMSPs (Electric Mobility Service Providers), primarily for roaming partnerships.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use lowercase unless referring to the specific Hub feature.
 • Avoid abbreviation unless previously defined.
 

 Platform: Hub
 Audience: B2B

Description: Internal and operator-facing functionality that lets users create or update multiple assets or configurations in a single operation, instead of performing each action one by one.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use as a noun (e.g. “run a bulk import,” “the Bulk Import flow”); avoid using it as a verb (“to bulk import”).
 • Keep it singular; avoid “Bulk Imports” — use “bulk import operations” or “bulk import jobs” if you need to express plurality.
 • Avoid using “Bulk Import” in B2C or driver-facing copy; it is intended for internal and operator contexts where technical, process-focused language is appropriate, while still staying clear and human. 
 

 Platform: Hub, Control
 Audience: B2B

Description: Charge point status indicating that the hardware is currently in use or reserved. May include sub-states such as blocked, scheduled, or actively charging.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use lowercase in text.
 • In UI, display as “Busy.”
 • Do not apply to people or teams.
 

 Platform: Charge, Hub
 Audience: B2B and B2C

escription:
 An OCPP-based method that enables a Charge Point Management System (CPMS) to communicate live pricing data, such as price per kWh, ongoing cost, and total cost, to a charge point during an active charging session. Originally developed to meet California’s transparency regulations, it is now widely adopted as a best-practice standard for real-time tariff display and cost calculation in EV charging.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Keep capitalization (“California Pricing”).
 • Use the full term on first mention and include a brief explanation if context is technical.
 • Do not translate or localize.
 • Use only when referring to the specific OCPP-based functionality, not as a general description of regional or geographic pricing.
 • Avoid abbreviating (e.g., “Cal Pricing”) or using as a generic label.
 

 Platform: Hub, Control
 Audience: B2B

terms.description:
Description: Italian billing compliance term used exclusively in Italy for legally recognized electronic communications between entities (geo-specific term). There is no equivalent in other locales; do descriptive translation. 
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use lowercase.
 • Apply only in Italian market and legal or billing contexts.
 • Do not replace with “email” in other languages.
 

 Platform: Control
 Audience: B2B

Description: Monta’s record of shipped product updates, feature releases, accessed in HUB, under “What’s new” side panel label, hosted by Beamer. 
 

 Usage rules:
 • Capitalize “Changelog” when referring to the UI label; use lowercase in generic references.
 

 Platform: Hub
 Audience: B2B

Description: Adjective. Used to describe a charging-related object, log, or record linked to a session or transaction. Examples: “charge log,” “charge ID,” “charge object.”
 

 Usage rules:
 • Always lowercase.
 • Use only as a descriptive modifier.
 • Avoid using where “charging” is the more natural form for localization.
 

 Platform: Hub, Control
 Audience: B2B

Description: Monta’s mobile app for EV drivers to find, start, schedule, and pay for charging sessions.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Reduce combination “Monta Charge” It is redundant and hardcoded for white label partners. 
 • Do not translate, pluralize. Uninflected across all languages, treated as brand-like identifiers. 
 • Use “charging app” only when referring to a generic category.
 

 Platform: Charge
 Audience: B2C

Description: Noun. The event or session during which an EV is connected to a charge point and receives electricity until completion.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use “charge” to describe the session event.
 • Do not use “charge” alone to mean fee or payment.
 • Keep lowercase except in proper nouns (e.g., Charge History).
 

 Platform: Charge
 Audience: B2C

Description: Verb. To supply electricity to an EV using a charge point or compatible setup.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use only for the energy transfer process, not payment.
 • In UI, use imperative form (“Charge now”).
 • In documentation, use infinitive (“to charge an EV”).
 • Lowercase unless at sentence start or part of a product name.
 

 Platform: Charge, Help Center
 Audience: B2C

Description: A header label in the Me section of the Charge app that displays a user’s charging logs, including energy delivered (kWh), charge point name, and total cost.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use Sentence Case (“Charge history), when referring to UI element, lower case, when in the running text. 
 • Always use the plural form (“Charge History”), even when referring to a single entry.
 

 Platform: Charge
 Audience: B2C

Description: A physical device (RFID card or fob) used to identify a user or team and authorize charging on compatible charge points.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use “charge key” in consumer-facing and support content.
 • Use “RFID card” or “RFID tag” in technical, integration, or API documentation.
 • Lowercase in running text unless used in a UI label (e.g., “Charge Key Settings”).
 

 Platform: Charge, Hub
 Audience: B2B and B2C

Description: The maximum battery level to which an electric vehicle (EV) is charged during a session, usually defined by the user or the vehicle’s system.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Always lowercase (“charge limit”).
 • Use “charge limit” in text and labels.
 • Express as a percentage (%) in UI when shown numerically.
 

 Platform: Charge, Hub
 Audience: B2C

Description: Default term for an electrical outlet or station that supplies power for charging plug-in electric vehicles (EVs). Sometimes referred to as a charger or charging station in copy.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Always use “charge point” as the default term across Monta content.
 • Translate into the standard local equivalent for EV infrastructure in localized versions.
 • Avoid overusing “charger” or “station” unless required for clarity or local context.
 

 Platform: Hub, Charge, Control
 Audience: B2B and B2C

translations.translation: borne de recharge default term / borne - only in space-constrained contexts

terms.description:
Description: Software platform used by operators to monitor, manage, and optimize EV charging infrastructure, including connectivity, pricing, access, reporting, and integrations.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use the full term “charge point management system” in general or product-facing copy.
 • Introduce abbreviation “CPMS” in technical documentation after first mention.
 • Do not use “CSMS.”
 • When referring to Monta’s system, use “Monta Hub.”
 

 Platform: Hub
 Audience: B2B

système de gestion des bornes de recharge
système de gestion de borne de recharge
sistema di gestione dei punti di ricarica
sistemul de gestionare al stației de încărcare

terms.description:
Description: Entity that owns, operates, and maintains EV charge points or networks. In Monta’s ecosystem, operators are classified as Partners, with dedicated features supporting their operations.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use lowercase (“charge point operator”) unless abbreviated.
 • Reduce usage of abbrev., unless well-established. Introduce the abbreviation “CPO” on first mention, then use consistently thereafter.
 • Keep consistent with industry usage and avoid shortening to “operator” alone.
 

 Platform: Hub, Control, Charge
 Audience: B2B

Description: Settings section in the Charge app for configuring individual charge point details and behavior.
 

 Usage rules:
 • When refererring to UI label, stand alone title, use sentence case (“Charge point settings”) in the source, use title case for en_US.
 • Maintain capitalization consistency with other Charge app section titles.
 

 Platform: Charge
 Audience: B2C

translations.translation: paramètres de la borne de recharge
paramètres de la borne de recharge

terms.description:
Description: Add-on service for maintaining private charge points, typically provided by operators or installers. Used mainly for private ownership models.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use lowercase (“charge point subscription”).
 • Do not abbreviate or shorten.
 • Refer only to the defined operator product offering, not to general Monta subscription models.
 

 Platform: Charge
 Audience: B2C

Description: Amount of electrical power delivered from the charge point to the EV at a given moment, measured in kilowatts (kW).
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use for live or measured performance data (telemetry, dashboards, analytics).
 • Do not confuse with “charged energy” (kWh).
 • Format units as lowercase “kW” with a non-breaking space (e.g., “11 kW”).
 • Use “charging speed” in consumer-facing or simplified copy.
 

 Platform: Hub, Charge
 Audience: B2B and B2C

Description: The total price accumulated during a charging session, including components such as price per kWh, per minute, or membership rates.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Always lowercase (“charge price”).
 • Do not shorten to “price” when referring to session cost.
 • Differentiate clearly from configuration or tariff setup prices in Hub.
 

 Platform: Charge, Hub
 Audience: B2B and B2C

Description: The duration in which an EV is connected to a charge point and receiving power until the session ends.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Always lowercase (“charge session”).
 • Prefer “charge session” over “charge” alone for clarity in UI and documentation.
 • Maintain consistency across reports, app logs, and analytics dashboards.
 

 Platform: Charge, Hub
 Audience: B2B and B2C

Description: UI label on the Charge app home screen linking to the list or map of available charging locations.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Always use Title Case (“Chargers”).
 • Always plural, never singular.
 • Do not replace with “Charge points,” “Stations,” or “Sites.”
 

 Platform: Charge
 Audience: B2C

Description: Adjective. Describes states, processes, or attributes related to an ongoing charge. Examples: “charging session,” “charging port,” “charging time.”
 

 Usage rules:
 • Always lowercase (“charging”).
 • Use only as a modifier (adjective).
 • Avoid redundancy when the context already implies charging (e.g., “charging session” → not “EV charging session”).
 

 Platform: Charge, Hub
 Audience: B2B and B2C

Description: Noun. The act or process of supplying electricity to an EV battery via a charge point.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Always lowercase (“charging”).
 • Use for general or conceptual process descriptions.
 • Do not confuse with “charge” (noun), which refers to a specific session or transaction.
 • Avoid when referring to a single event — use “charge session” instead.
 

 Platform: Charge, Help Center
 Audience: B2B and B2C

Description: Generic term for mobile applications that enable EV drivers to find, start, schedule, and pay for charging sessions.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use “charging app” only when referring to the category of EV charging applications.
 • Never use in UI, use “Monta Charge” when referring specifically to Monta’s product.
 • Keep lowercase in running text.
 • May be used in comparative or educational contexts (e.g., “Unlike other charging apps…”).
 

 Platform: Marketing, SEO content, Documentation
 Audience: B2C and B2B

Description: A cable that connects an electric vehicle to a charge point to transfer electricity for charging.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use “charging cable” in documentation, help content, and marketing materials.
 • In UI, use the short form “Cable” when context is clear.
 • Do not abbreviate (avoid “EV cable” or “CP cable”).
 • Differentiate clearly from connector (plug) and charge point (hardware).
 

 Platform: Hub, Charge
 Audience: B2C and B2B

Description: A feature within the Charge Subscription plan that allows users to apply a discount to charging sessions.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Avoid “charge” as it can indicate “fee”
 • Use only when describing product features or subscription benefits.
 • Do not use as a synonym for pricing or promotions.
 

 Platform: Hub
 Audience: B2B

Description: A fee type applied during a charging session after a specified time threshold, e.g., DKK 50,00 added after 60 minutes of charging.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Always lowercase (“charging fee”).
 • Use in documentation or UI where the fee condition is defined.
 • Always specify timing or application condition.
 

 Platform: Hub, Control
 Audience: B2B

Description: The instantaneous rate at which electrical energy is transferred or used during charging. Expressed in kilowatts (kW).  
 

 Usage rules: 
 • Preferred terms: “power,” “charging power.” Avoid using “charging speed” in technical UI; reserve it only for consumer-friendly copy if needed. 
 

 Platform: Hub, Charge, Control
 Audience: B2B and B2C

Description: Feature in the Charge app allowing users to pre-define charge schedules when plugging into a private charge point, automating repetitive home-charging actions.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Always lowercase (“charging rule”).
 • Mention only in relation to the scheduling functionality within the app.
 • Do not use as a synonym for “policy” or “restriction.”
 

 Platform: Charge
 Audience: B2C

Description: Plan that defines when an EV should start or stop charging, enabling users to optimize for energy cost or grid demand. Managed via the Schedule feature in the Charge app.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Always lowercase (“charging schedule”).
 • Prefer “Schedule” when referring to the UI feature name.
 • Use the full phrase in documentation or support contexts for clarity.
 

 Platform: Charge
 Audience: B2C

Description: A physical location containing one or more charge points and the necessary infrastructure for EV charging.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Always lowercase (“charging site”).
 • Use consistently in B2B or operator-facing contexts instead of “station.”
 • Avoid “charging station” unless required for third-party integration documentation.
 

 Platform: Hub, Control
 Audience: B2B

Description: The rate at which an EV battery gains energy during charging, expressed as power (kW) or estimated time to charge.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Always lowercase (“charging speed”).
 • Use in consumer or marketing contexts.
 • Use “charge power (kW)” for technical accuracy or live telemetry data.
 • Do not confuse with “charging time” (duration).
 

 Platform: Charge
 Audience: B2C

Description: Label for the communication feature within Monta used to exchange messages between users, charge point owners, or Monta Support. “Chat” can refer to both the in-app messaging tool and its associated action (to chat).
 

 Usage rules:
 • Always capitalize (“Chat”) when referring to the product feature or UI label.
 • Use lowercase (“chat”) when referring to the action (e.g., “chat with support”).
 • Use consistently across Charge for user-to-user and support communication.
 

 Platform: Charge
 Audience: B2C

Description: A private key used in Monta’s API authentication (OAuth 2.0). It identifies and authenticates a client application (such as a partner integration) to the Monta API securely, ensuring only authorized systems can access protected data.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Always lowercase (“client secret”).
 • Use only in technical and developer documentation.
 • Use alongside related terms like “client ID” and “API key.”
 

 Platform: HUB
 Audience: B2B

Description: A vehicle provided by an employer for business or mixed (business and personal) use. In Monta, Company Car agreements link employees’ charging sessions to their employer’s Monta Wallet. Work-related charges are automatically reimbursed, and wallet reconciliation is managed through the Company Car reimbursement flow.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use lowercase (“company car”) in text.
 • Use only in fleet or reimbursement-related contexts.
 

 Platform: Hub
 Audience: B2B

Description: A legal business identifier assigned to a company in its country of registration. In Monta, this number is required for business account setup, billing, and regulatory compliance within the EU and UK.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use lowercase (“company registration number”).
 • Do not abbreviate (avoid “CRN”).
 • Use in forms, billing flows, and verification processes.
 

 Platform: Hub
 Audience: B2B

translations.translation: numero di iscrizione al registro delle imprese

terms.description:
Description: Verb used when a charge point or external system establishes a link with Monta software, either via OCPP (Open Charge Point Protocol), Partner API, or physical plug-in connection by a driver.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Always lowercase (“connect”).
 • Use as a verb in product copy (e.g., “Connect a charge point to Monta”).
 • Avoid as a noun (do not use “connection” unless describing a network state).
 

 Platform: Hub, Control
 Audience: B2B and B2C

Description: The physical interface (socket or cable end) that connects the electric vehicle (EV) to the charge point. Supported connector types in Monta include Type 2, CCS, Type 1, CHAdeMO, and others. Each connector is tracked individually for status, pricing, and reporting in Monta Hub.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Always lowercase (“connector”) in running text.
 • Use singular or plural as context requires.
 • Distinguish clearly from “cable” (the wire) and “port” (the vehicle inlet).
 

 Platform: Hub, Control
 Audience: B2B

Description: Defines the actual cost of electricity for an operator or team. A cost group represents what the operator pays (the “cost price”) rather than what is charged to end users (the “sale price”). Cost groups are used for internal reporting, budgeting, and profitability analysis - not for payments or transactions.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Always lowercase (“cost group”), unless used as UI label: “Cost Group”
 • Use only in pricing or operator cost contexts.
 • Do not confuse with “pricing group” or “tariff.”
 

 Platform: Hub
 Audience: B2B

Description: Acronym for Charge Point - the hardware device providing EV charging. In Monta documentation, “charge point” is preferred for clarity, especially in English. Each charge point can have multiple connectors and be linked to teams, sites, or operators.
 

 Usage rules:
 • . Use “CP” only after introducing the full term (“Charge Point (CP)”).
 • Use only in technical documentation or developer contexts.
 • Prefer “charge point” over “CP” in UI, marketing, or consumer-facing content.
 

 Platform: Hub
 Audience: B2B

Description: An acronym for Charge Point Integration, which enables communication and data exchange between charging stations and central management systems or external platforms. It supports data flow, status updates, and control signals across connected systems.

Usage rules:
Always capitalize the acronym “CPI.”
Spell out “Charge Point Integration (CPI)” on first mention in documentation or long-form content.
Use only in technical or integration-related contexts; avoid in high-level customer-facing copy.
Do not use as a replacement for specific protocols or standards (e.g., OCPP) when those are meant.

Platform: Hub, Control
Audience: B2B

Description: Acronym for Charge Point Management System. In Monta’s context, this refers to Monta Hub, the central platform used by operators and partners to manage charge points, sites, users, pricing, and operational workflows.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Always capitalize “CPMS.”
 • Spell out “Charge Point Management System (CPMS)” on first mention.
 • Prefer “Monta Hub” when referring to Monta’s own CPMS, but it can be used to describe comparable systems.
 • Do not shorten to “management system.”
 

 Platform: Hub
 Audience: B2B

translations.translation: CPMS (Système de gestion de bornes de recharge)
SGSÎ (Sistemul de Gestionare al Stației de Încărcare)
Système de gestion des bornes de recharge

alternatives.alternative: Electric Vehicle Charge Point Management System

terms.description:
Description: Abbreviation for Charge Point Operator, the entity responsible for operating, maintaining, and managing EV charge points or sites. In Monta, CPOs use Monta Hub to manage their network, set pricing, monitor uptime, and integrate with payment systems.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Always capitalize when referring to this role or partner type.
 • Introduce abbreviation “CPO” in parentheses after first mention and use consistently thereafter.
 • Avoid using “operator” alone when referring to this entity.
 

 Platform: Hub, Control
 Audience: B2B

Description: Non-withdrawable funds stored in a team wallet, used to pay for Monta-related transactions such as charging sessions, subscriptions, or fees. Credits can be earned through referrals, promotions, or PowerBank participation and are tracked separately from withdrawable wallet balances.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use lowercase “credit” in running text.
 • Use plural “credits” when referring to multiple units.
 • Do not confuse with “wallet balance” or “withdrawable funds.”
 • Use only when referring to non-withdrawable wallet funds.
 

 Platform: Hub, Charge
 Audience: B2B and B2C

Description: A financial document issued to correct or reduce the amount of a previously issued invoice, typically due to returns, adjustments, or billing errors. In Monta, credit notes appear in the Finance section of Hub and are automatically linked to the original invoice.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use lowercase “credit note” in running text.
 • Use plural “credit notes” for multiple documents.
 • Do not shorten to “note” alone.
 • Use only in billing and finance contexts.
 

 Platform: Hub
 Audience: B2B

Description: A Current Transformer (CT) clamp is a device used to measure electrical current flowing through a conductor without direct contact. In Monta, CT clamps are used in Smart Meter and Load Balancing setups to provide real-time current measurements from a site’s main fuse or solar installation. These readings help Monta’s CPI service optimize charging based on available power.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Spell out on first mention: “Current Transformer (CT) clamp.”
 • Use abbreviation “CT clamp” thereafter.
 • Keep “CT” capitalized as it is a technical abbreviation.
 • Use only in technical or installer-facing documentation.
 

 Platform: Control, Hub
 Audience: B2B

Description: The flow of electric charge that powers an EV during charging. Monta supports both Alternating Current (AC) and Direct Current (DC) charging, depending on the charge point hardware and configuration. Current type affects charging speed and connector compatibility.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use lowercase “current” in running text.
 • Use “AC” and “DC” in uppercase when referring to current types.
 • Avoid using in isolation in UI; specify type where relevant (e.g., “AC current”).
 

 Platform: Hub, Control
 Audience: B2B

Description: A feature in Monta Hub that allows charge point operators or service providers to create tailored subscription plans for their clients. These plans can include services such as charge point operation, maintenance, leasing, software access, or tax refund management. End users are billed monthly through Monta, and payments are handled via the Wallet and Subscriptions modules.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use lowercase in running text unless appearing as a feature name or UI label.
 • Avoid shortening to “subscription” when referring to custom plans.
 • Use only in Hub contexts related to service management.
 

 Platform: Hub
 Audience: B2B

Description: A Monta specialist responsible for onboarding new business users, ensuring successful adoption of Monta’s platform, and supporting long-term account growth. Customer Success Managers (CSMs) proactively assist partners (CPOs, installers, or enterprises) to achieve operational success and maximize value from Monta Hub and related services.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use lowercase in running text; capitalize when referring to a specific title (e.g., “Your Customer Success Manager will contact you”).
 • Introduce abbreviation “CSM” after first mention and use consistently.
 • Use only for Monta internal and partner-facing roles.
 

 Platform: Hub
 Audience: B2B

Description: B2B feature in Monta Hub that allows operators to discover, connect, and monitor managed data-sharing integrations with external systems. Data Pipelines automate the secure delivery of static and dynamic data to endpoints such as National Access Points (NAPs), AFIR compliance systems, rebate programs, and other partner or regulatory platforms.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Sentence case capitalization “Data pipelines” when referring to the Hub feature or UI label.
 • Use lowercase “data pipelines” in general descriptions.
 • Avoid shortening to “pipelines” without context.
 • Use only in data integration or compliance contexts.
 

 Platform: Hub
 Audience: B2B

Description: Monta’s centralized, cloud-based data storage and analytics system that enables sharing of operational and performance data with partners through secure integrations or embedded dashboards. It supports advanced analytics, exports, and visualization features such as Tableau dashboards, data pipelines, and API feeds.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Do not translate, except for fr_CA
 • Use only when referring to Monta’s internal or partner-accessible data infrastructure.
 • Avoid using as a synonym for “database.”
 

 Platform: Hub, Control
 Audience: B2B

Description: A Monta product add-on available for partner and operator subscriptions. Data+ unlocks enhanced data capabilities such as advanced analytics, detailed charge point performance insights, extended data retention, or additional integrations beyond the standard Monta Hub plan.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Always write as “Data+” with the plus sign included. Uninflected across all languages, treated as brand-like identifiers. 
 • Capitalize “D” and retain the symbol across all languages.
 • Use only when referring to the paid add-on module.
 • Do not translate, except for fr_CA
 

 Platform: Hub
 Audience: B2B

Description: Type of charging using Direct Current (DC), delivering higher power outputs than AC (Alternating Current). DC charge points enable fast and ultra-fast charging, typically located at public charging parks or highways.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Always capitalize “DC” and “AC.”
 • Use “DC charge point,” not “DC unit” in customer-facing copy.
 

 Platform: Charge, Hub
 Audience: B2B and B2C

Description: A unique URL that connects directly to a specific charge point or related page, enabling EV drivers to start charging by scanning a QR code or NFC tag. In Monta Hub, the Deeplinks feature allow Solution Providers to create, link, and manage deeplinks remotely.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Capitalize “Deeplink” when referring to the Hub feature name.
 • Use lowercase “deeplink” when referring to an individual link or general concept.
 • Use plural “deeplinks” when describing multiple URLs.
 • Use only in contexts involving charge point access, QR/NFC integration, or Solution Provider workflows.
 • Avoid abbreviations (e.g., “DL”) or replacing with “link.”
 

 Platform: Hub
 Audience: B2B

Description: A smart charging scheduling option that allows users to postpone the start of a charging session. When enabled, the session begins automatically at the optimal or user-defined time, usually to align with lower energy prices or grid-friendly charging windows.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use lowercase “delayed start” in running text.
 • Use Title Case “Delayed Start” in UI labels or menu items.
 • Use only in charging or scheduling feature contexts.
 

 Platform: Charge
 Audience: B2C

Description: Noun, funds added to a user’s or team’s Monta Wallet and made available for payments or transactions such as charging, or subscriptions. Deposits are withdrawable.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use lowercase “deposit” in running text.
 • Use plural “deposits” when referring to multiple transactions.
 • Avoid confusing with “credit” or “top-up.”
 

 Platform: Hub, Charge
 Audience: B2B and B2C

Description: A Distribution System Operator (DSO) manages and maintains the local electricity distribution grid that delivers power from transmission systems to end users. In Monta’s context, DSOs are external stakeholders in grid-service integrations such as PowerBank, Smart Charging, and Load Management, where real-time load data or flexibility services may be exchanged.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Spell out on first mention: “distribution system operator (DSO).”
 • Use abbreviation “DSO” thereafter.
 • Use only in energy, grid, or flexibility contexts.
 

 Platform: Hub, Control
 Audience: B2B
Description: Abbreviation for Distribution System Operator. See distribution system operator (DSO) for the full definition.

Description: A load management method that dynamically allocates available electrical power between multiple charge points in real time, based on total site consumption. Dynamic Load Balancing ensures grid limits are respected while optimizing charging speed for connected EVs. It relies on external meters such as CT clamps or smart meters to measure total consumption and continuously adjust power distribution.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use lowercase “dynamic load balancing” in running text.
 • Use Title Case “Dynamic load balancing” when referring to the Hub feature name or label.
 • Avoid shortening to “DLB.”
 

 Platform: Hub, Control
 Audience: B2B

Description: A price group type where the base (master) price follows the spot market price for electricity. Dynamic pricing fluctuates with market rates and can include operator-defined markups or limits. Used by CPOs to align charging prices with real-time energy costs.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use lowercase “dynamic price” in running text.
 • Use “dynamic pricing” when referring to the broader pricing method.
 • Use only in pricing or energy cost configuration contexts.
 

 Platform: Hub
 Audience: B2B

Description: A company that offers charging services to drivers via apps, subscriptions, or roaming networks, including account creation, authentication, and billing. In Monta, an e-mobility service provider connects driver access with charging networks for pricing, payments, and roaming.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Spell as “e-mobility service provider” (hyphen after “e”). Use sentence case in running text.
 • Introduce abbreviation on first mention: “e-mobility service provider (eMSP)”; use “eMSP” thereafter. Article: “an eMSP.” Plural: “eMSPs.”
 • Use when referring to the driver-facing service entity; do not use when you mean the infrastructure operator—use “Charge Point Operator (CPO)” instead.
 • In UI and configuration (e.g., roaming, partner type), use “eMSP” for brevity and consistency.
 • Avoid alternatives like “mobility provider” or “charging provider” unless required by third-party naming.
 

 Platform: Hub, Charge
 Audience: B2B and B2C

translations.translation: proveedor de servicios de movilidad eléctrica
fournisseur de services de mobilité électrique
fournisseur de services de mobilité électrique
fornitore di servizi di mobilità elettrica

terms.description:
Description: Employer Identification Number (EIN): a 9-digit U.S. federal tax ID used to identify businesses. 
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use only for U.S. entities. For non-U.S. markets, use the relevant term (e.g., VAT number, company registration number).
 • Avoid generic “tax number” or “company number” when referring to U.S. EINs to maintain consistency.
 

 Platform: Hub
 Audience: B2B
General term, indicating electricity costs. Applied for pricing setting.

Description: The amount charged to drivers for consumed energy, expressed as a per-kWh rate. In Monta, it’s the energy component of a charging session price, separate from time fees or fixed session fees.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use when referring specifically to the per-kWh part of the price; for the full amount a driver pays, use “charging price” or “total price.”
 • In UI, label as “Energy price (per kWh)”; avoid “power price.”
 • Singular by default (“electricity price”); use plural (“electricity prices”) only when comparing multiple sites or tariffs.
 • Do not use for utility tariffs; prefer “energy tariff” or “utility tariff” when referring to supplier rates.
 

 Platform: Hub, Charge
 Audience: B2B and B2C

Description: A Danish government scheme that reimburses private EV owners for the electricity tax paid on home charging, provided charging is metered and handled via an approved subscription or provider.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use descriptive translation for other languages than Danish, since it’s a da-centric concept.
 • Avoid using as a synonym for “reimbursement” (employer pays driver)
 

 

 Platform: Hub
 Audience: B2B

translations.translation: remboursement de la taxe sur l’électricité
remboursement de la taxe sur l’électricité

terms.description:
Description: A Danish government scheme that reimburses private EV owners for the electricity tax paid on home charging, provided charging is metered and handled via an approved subscription or provider.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use descriptive translation for other languages than Danish, since it’s a da-centric concept.
 • Avoid using as a synonym for “reimbursement” (employer pays driver)
 

 

 Platform: Hub
 Audience: B2B

terms.description:
Description: An eMobility Service Provider (eMSP) is a company or platform that gives EV drivers access to public and private charge points across multiple networks through a single app, card, or account. In Monta’s context, Monta acts as an eMSP by enabling users to discover, start, and pay for charging sessions across Monta-connected and external (roaming) networks via the Monta App.
 

 Usage x rules:
 • Always capitalize “eMSP.”
 • Spell out “eMobility Service Provider (eMSP)” on first mention.
 • Use only in contexts related to roaming, interoperability, or cross-network charging.
 • Avoid using “service provider” alone when referring to this entity.
 • In UI or partner documentation, clearly distinguish eMSP from “CPO.”
 

 Platform: Charge, Hub
 Audience: B2B and B2C

Description: The timestamp when a charging session, schedule, or reservation finishes. In Monta, it marks the close of a time range paired with a start time for reporting, pricing, and availability.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use for actual completion timestamps.
 • Avoid synonyms like “finish time” or “stop time” in customer-facing copy; keep “end time” consistent across surfaces.
 

 Platform: Hub, Charge, Control
 Audience: B2B and B2C

Description: The amount of energy delivered during a charging session, expressed in kilowatt-hours (kWh).
 

 Usage rules:
 • Always lowercase (“charge amount”).
 • Avoid using this term to refer to price, payment, or cost.
 

 Platform: Hub, Control
 Audience: B2B

Description: Electric vehicle (EV): a road vehicle powered fully or primarily by electricity from a battery. In Monta, used to identify the driver’s or fleet’s vehicle type for charging, pricing, and reporting.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Article: “an EV.” Plural: “EVs.”
 • Always capitalize the abbreviation “EV.” Use sentence case for the full term in running text.
 • Avoid redundant phrasing like “EV car”; prefer “EV” or “vehicle.”
 • Use “vehicle” (not “EV”) if the context already implies electric (e.g., within an EV-only list or filter).
 • In UI labels and filters, use “EV” for brevity (e.g., “EV model,” “EV battery”); 
 

 Platform: Hub, Charge, Control
 Audience: B2B and B2C

Description: Electric Vehicle Supply Equipment (EVSE): the physical charging hardware that controls and meters energy delivery and communicates with Monta via OCPP. In Monta, “EVSE” refers to the connected charging equipment managed as a charge point in Hub and Control.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Always capitalize the abbreviation “EVSE”; do not use periods.
 • Use in technical contexts (integrations, OCPP settings, installation guides). Avoid in driver-facing copy—prefer “charger” or “charge point.”
 • In UI for operators/installers, prefer “charge point”; reserve “EVSE” only where required by standards, API fields, or technical logs.
 

 

 Platform: Hub, Control
 Audience: B2B

Description: US-centric, a government-imposed tax on specific goods or energy use in the US. A tax imposed during EV charging in the US. No direct tax directive is applicable in EU. 
 

 Usage rules:
 • Do not use for VAT, sales tax, grid fees, or levies—name those specifically.
 • Do not use as a synonym for “surcharge” or “fee.” Keep terminology consistent across pricing, reporting, and exports.
 

 Platform: Hub
 Audience: B2B

Description: A mode that defaults to a safe state when a component, signal, or process fails. 
 

 Usage rules:
 • Spell with a hyphen: “fail-safe.” Do not use “failsafe” or “fail safe.”
 • Use lowercase in running text; Sentence in labels or headings.
 • Can be an adjective (“fail-safe mode”) or a countable noun (“a fail-safe”). Plural: “fail-safes.”
 

 Platform: Hub, Control
 Audience: B2B

Description: Concept to benchmark good/bad market price on a public charge point for end-users. A filtering option in Maps in Charge app.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use lowercase in running text: “fair price.” Do not capitalize or abbreviate.

Description: A default price applied automatically when the intended tariff or price source is unavailable. The fallback price ensures sessions can be billed when normal pricing cannot be resolved.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use lowercase in running text: “fallback price.” In UI labels and settings, use “Fallback price.”
 • Avoid synonyms like “backup price” or “base price”; keep terminology consistent with “fallback price.”
 

 Platform: Hub, Charge
 Audience: B2B and B2C

Description: A monetary amount added to a charging session that is not the per-kWh energy price or a tax. In Monta, fees cover extras such as a fixed session fee, a per-minute time fee, or other operator-defined charges.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Plural: “fees.” Article: “a fee.”
 • In UI labels and settings, capitalize as “Fee,” and name the type explicitly (e.g., “Session fee,” “Time fee”).
 • Avoid vague terms like “extra charge” or “surcharge”; name the fee type.
 

 Platform: Hub, Charge
 Audience: B2B and B2C

Description: A time-based fee charged for each minute of a charging session or an idle period. In Monta, it’s configured by operators and applied alongside the per-kWh energy price when enabled.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use for time-based pricing during charging or after a grace period (idle). Do not use for energy consumption—use “energy price (per kWh).”
 • Distinguish from “session fee” (fixed amount). Name the exact fee type in customer-facing copy.
 • Article: “a per-minute fee.” Plural: “per-minute fees.” Do not abbreviate.
 

 Platform: Hub, Charge
 Audience: B2B and B2C

Description: A add-on subscription plan that extends billing, settlements, and reporting with advanced features (e.g., automated invoicing, payouts/reconciliation, and accounting exports)
 

 Usage rules:
 • Write exactly as “Finance+” (capital F, plus sign, no space). Do not use “Finance Plus” or “Finance Plus+.”
 • Do not abbreviate. Pluralize only when referring to subscriptions or entitlements (e.g., “Finance+ subscriptions”).
 • Use only for the Monta product/plan component.
 

 Platform: Hub
 Audience: B2B

Description: embedded software on charging hardware that provides low-level control and enables communication with Monta (e.g., via OCPP). In Monta, firmware affects safety checks, metering, connector control, and interoperability.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use lowercase in running text: “firmware.” No abbreviation.
 • Prefer precise collocations: “firmware update,” “firmware version,” “firmware release.”
 • Plurals: use “firmware versions” (not “firmwares”)
 

 Platform: Hub, Control
 Audience: B2B

Description: A static charging tariff you set either per kWh or per minute. Unlike spot pricing, the rate remains constant until you change it.
 

  Usage rules: 
 - Use in pricing settings, tariffs, and documentation; mention “spot pricing” when comparing alternatives. 
 - Use without an article in UI labels; use “a Fixed Price tariff” in running text. 
 

 Platform: Hub, Charge
  Audience: B2B and B2C (shared)

Description: A business-managed group of vehicles supported by Monta for public and depot charging. Includes tools for planning, cost control, load management, and future V2G workflows.
 

 Usage rules:
 - Use lowercase “fleet” in running text; capitalize only if part of a feature or stand alone UI label.
 - Use for business-operated vehicle groups; do not use for personal driver groups.
 - Do not confuse with “team” or “company” in Monta account structures.
 

 Platform: Hub, Control
 Audience: B2B

Description: Predictive estimates of charging demand, timing, or energy usage generated from historical and operational data. Used to plan schedules and reduce energy costs across sites.
 

 Usage rules:
 - Use lowercase in running text; capitalize only when matching a UI label or report title.
 - Use to describe predictive outputs, not commitments or reservations.
 - Not a synonym for “schedule” or “booking.”
 - No abbreviations; if used as a verb, write “to forecast.”
 

 Platform: Hub, Control
 Audience: B2B

Description: Funds represent the withdrawable monetary balance available in a Monta wallet. Funds can be transferred to a user’s private bank account through Monta’s integrated payout system.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use lowercase “funds” in running text; capitalize only when matching an exact UI label.
 • Use “balance” for the current amount; use “funds” when referring to the withdrawable money or movements.
 • Plural noun; do not abbreviate.
 • Avoid synonyms such as “credits” or “cash” in product copy.
 

 Platform: Hub, Charge
 Audience: B2B, B2C

Description: Limits charging so the site’s electrical fuse or circuit capacity is not exceeded. Managed through Monta load management to distribute power across charge points and prevent overloads or tripped fuses.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Do not abbreviate; avoid “fusing.”
 

 Platform: Hub, Control, Charge
 Audience: B2B, B2C

Description: A short period before or after a charging session during which a driver is not charged idle fees or overstay fees.
 

 usage rules: 
 - Do not pluralize unless referring to multiple configurations (“grace periods”).
 - Use only when referring to fee-free buffer time linked to a charging session.
 - Avoid alternatives like “free time,” “buffer,” or “no-fee window.”
 - If shown in UI, ensure the exact value is displayed (e.g., “5-minute grace period”)
 

 Platform: Charge, Hub
 Audience: B2B and B2C

Description: The external electricity network that supplies energy to Monta-connected sites and can receive energy in V2G setups. Monta coordinates charging (e.g., load balancing, PowerBank) to avoid overloads and support grid stability.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use for the public network; for on-site wiring use “installation
 • Do not use as a synonym for “utility” or “DSO” unless explicitly named.
 

 

 Platform: Hub, Control
 Audience: B2B

Description: Monta’s premium growth-focused subscription plan providing advanced management, automation, and analytics capabilities. Designed for operators and partners scaling beyond the Free plan to increase operational efficiency.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Write “Growth+” exactly with the plus sign; do not abbreviate.
 • Refer to the plan as “the Growth+ plan” in running text; use the exact label in UI.
 • Use only for the official subscription tier; do not generalize to promotions or discounts.
 • Avoid synonyms like “Pro” or “Premium” unless officially renamed.
 

 Platform: Hub
 Audience: B2B

Description: Physical charge points and connected electrical devices integrated with the Monta platform. Compatibility and performance rely on certified integrations and firmware that enable features such as load balancing, PowerBank, and SolarCharging.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use lowercase in running text; capitalize only when part of a proper name or UI label.
 • Use “charge point” for the EVSE; avoid generic “charger” when precision is needed.
 

 

 Platform: Hub, Control
 Audience: B2B

Description: Monta’s ability to work with any compatible charge point brand or model. Enables mixing and managing multiple hardware types in one setup without vendor lock-in.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use “hardware agnostic” in sentence case in running text; capitalize only in headings or UI labels.
 • Do not imply support for unsupported models; reference the certified hardware list where relevant.
 • Not a partnership or endorsement claim.
 

 Platform: Hub, Charge, Control
 Audience: B2B

Description: A company that designs and produces EV charge points compatible with Monta via certified integrations and APIs. Manufacturers use Hub to support configuration, firmware workflows, and reliable communication.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use lowercase in running text; capitalize only when part of a proper name (e.g., “ABB hardware manufacturer” → “ABB”).
 • Not the same as a charge point operator (CPO) or installer; use the precise role.
 • Pluralize as “hardware manufacturers”; do not abbreviate.
 

 Platform: Hub
 Audience: B2B

Description: Monta’s self-service knowledge base with product guides, troubleshooting articles, and instructional videos. Enables users to resolve issues and learn features across Monta products.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use the exact spelling “Help Centre” in the source (not “Help Center”); capitalize both words.
 • Use for knowledge base and support content; avoid using as a synonym for “Support” or “Status page.”
 • Use the exact label in links and buttons.
 • Do not abbreviate.
 

 Platform: Hub, Charge, Control
 Audience: B2B and B2C (shared)

Description: A residential EV charge point connected to Charge. Enables private users to schedule charging, use features like SolarCharging or PowerBank, and monitor energy usage at home.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use sentence case in running text; in technical contexts prefer “home charge point” for precision.
 • Do not use for workplace or public chargers.
 • Avoid using “charger” to refer to cables or adapters.
 

 Platform: Charge
 Audience: B2C

Description: Charging an electric vehicle at a private residence using a Monta-connected home charge point via Charge. Supports scheduling, smart features (e.g., solar charging, smart charging, and session monitoring.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use sentence case in running text (“home charging”); capitalize only in headings or UI labels.
 • Use for private residential contexts; do not use for workplace or public charging.
 • Use “home charger” or “home charge point” for the device; use “home charging” for the activity.
 

 Platform: Charge
 Audience: B2C

Description: Monta’s residential energy management scope connecting devices like charge points, solar, smart meters, and heat pumps to optimize electricity use and self-consumption. Coordinates charging and home energy flows to reduce grid dependency.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use sentence case (“home energy”) in running text; capitalize only in headings or UI labels.
 • Use when describing the overall residential energy setup; name specific devices/features when needed.
 • Avoid using as a product name unless labeled in UI; otherwise describe the capability.
 

 Platform: Charge
 Audience: B2C

Description: A collective property management organization that operates shared residential charging for tenants or owners. Monta enables centralized access control, billing, and reporting across shared charge points.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use sentence case in running text; capitalize only when part of a legal entity’s proper name.
 • Use for multi-dwelling/shared residential contexts; not for single-family homes or commercial sites.
 • Prefer “housing association” over “HOA” unless the local market requires that term.
 

 Platform: Hub, Charge
 Audience: B2B and B2C (shared)

Description: Monta’s web platform for managing charge points, sites, teams, pricing, and operations at scale. Provides tools for analytics, subscriptions, automation, and financial workflows for professional operators.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use the exact product name “Hub”; do not use “portal.” Uninflected across all languages, treated as brand-like identifier.
 • Capitalize “Hub” in all references; avoid abbreviations.
 

 Platform: Hub
 Audience: B2B

Description: A dedicated post-launch support phase for new partners or deployments focused on proactive monitoring, rapid issue resolution, and close cross-team collaboration. Ensures a stable rollout and optimal performance across Monta products.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Capitalize “Hypercare” when referring to the formal support phase.
 • Reference the specific scope (products, SLAs, duration) when documented.
 

 Platform: Hub, Charge, Control
 Audience: B2B

Description: A standardized international bank account identifier used in Monta wallet to enable withdrawals, deposits, and automated payouts. Required to link a user or operator bank account for payment operations.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Write “IBAN” in all caps; spell out “International Bank Account Number” on first mention if needed.
 • Do not localize the acronym; follow local formatting rules only when displaying IBANs from user input.
 • Not interchangeable with “account number” or “BIC/SWIFT.”
 

 Platform: Hub
 Audience: B2B

Description: A non-electric vehicle powered by petrol or diesel. Used in Monta context when contrasting with EVs in adoption, fleet transition, and operational policies.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use sentence case in running text (“ICE vehicle” with ICE in caps).
 • Do not use “gas car” in formal copy; use “ICE vehicle.”
 • Pluralize as “ICE vehicles.”
 

 Platform: Hub, Control
 Audience: B2B

Description: A fee applied when a vehicle remains parked and connected after charging has completed. Encourages charge point turnover and efficient site utilization.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use sentence case (“idle fee”) in running text; capitalize only in UI labels.
 • Distinguish from energy pricing; applies post-charge completion.
 

 Platform: Hub, Charge
 Audience: B2B and B2C (shared)

Description: The duration a vehicle stays connected after reaching full charge. Used to monitor congestion, manage turnover, and trigger idle fee policies.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use sentence case (“idle time”) in running text; capitalize only in UI labels.
 • Not a synonym for “parking time.”
 

 Platform: Hub, Charge
 Audience: B2B and B2C (shared)

Description: The official Monta podcast available on Spotify, covering EV charging, clean tech, and the future of sustainable energy. 
 

 Usage rules:
 • Treat as a proper name and write exactly “In-Between Charges” with hyphens and title case.
 • Do not translate or localize the podcast title; keep the English name in all languages.
 • Do not abbreviate (avoid “IBC”) and do not use the title to describe charging behavior.
 .
 

 Platform: Hub
 Audience: B2B and B2C (shared)

Description: A reported operational issue or failure within Monta systems or connected services (e.g., charge point error, API disruption, user-side fault). Incidents are tracked and resolved through support and engineering workflows.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use sentence case; capitalize only if matching a specific UI status.
 

 Platform: Hub, Control
 Audience: B2B

'Description: Actionable analytics and reports in Hub covering performance, usage, financials, and operational trends. Supports data-driven decisions and network optimization.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Capitalize “Insights” only if referring to a named module; otherwise use “insights” in sentence case.
 • Do not use as a synonym for “reports” when referring to downloadable invoices or receipts.
 

 Platform: Hub
 Audience: B2B

Description: The physical setup and configuration of EV charge points, including wiring, mounting, commissioning, and connecting hardware to Monta. Ensures safe, compliant, and functional operation.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use sentence case in running text; avoid using as a job role.
 

 Platform: Hub
 Audience: B2B

Description: A certified technician or partner who deploys and configures charge points for operators or end users. Uses Installer Jobs to connect, test, and verify hardware during setup.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use sentence case; capitalize only when part of a proper title.
 • Not the same as a charge point operator (CPO) or site owner.
 • Pluralize as “installers”; do not abbreviate.
 

 Platform: Hub
 Audience: B2B

Description: A predefined task in Hub granting installers temporary access to connect and commission charge points. Streamlines deployment by enabling testing and documentation without adding installers to operator teams.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Sentence title when used as a stand-alone UI label.
 • Use for time-bound commissioning tasks; not for ongoing maintenance.
 

 Platform: Hub
 Audience: B2B

Description: A lightweight, browser-based charging flow that lets drivers start and pay for a session without installing Charge. Simplifies public, ad-hoc charging access.
 

 Usage rules:

Description: An optimized charging session managed by Monta’s intelligent scheduling that adjusts start time and charging power to reduce cost and environmental impact. Factors include energy prices, grid signals, and renewable availability.
 

 Usag

Description: Data-driven feature that controls when and how vehicles charge based on grid load, energy prices, and user preferences. Ensures efficient, affordable, and sustainable energy use across sites.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Distinguish from “scheduled charging” (time-based only).
 • Do not change spelling, e.g. SmartCharge, Smart charging. and do not introduce synonyms, e.g. intelligent charging.
 

 Platform: Charge
 Audience: B2C

Description: B2C feature in Charge, enables EV charging directly from solar panels, using real-time or forecasted production data. Helps maximise self-consumption, reduce grid reliance, lower energy costs, and minimise carbon footprint. Can be configured to operate only when surplus solar energy is available.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Distinguish from “solar surplus charging” (surplus-only logic).
 • Use exact label and not modify it, e.g. SolarCharge, solar charge
 

 Platform: Charge
 Audience:B2C

Description: A solar mode where charging starts only when excess solar production is available, minimizing imported grid energy. Supports energy autonomy and cost control.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Distinguish from generic “solar charging.”
 

 Platform: Charge
 Audience: B2C

translations.translation: recharge à partir du surplus solaire

terms.description:
Description: A six-digit bank code used in the UK and Ireland to identify a specific bank and branch for an account. Used by Monta to validate bank details for withdrawals or direct debits in these markets.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use only in UK/IE in source; apply corresponding local term to represent the same concept across the languages. 
 • Never use in plural 
 

 Platform: Hub
 Audience: B2B

Description: Real-time electricity price per kWh from market data (e.g., Nord Pool) used to calculate dynamic charging costs and shift usage to cheaper hours. Available only in supported markets.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Distinguish from fixed price and member price tariffs.
 • In Price groups, use as the master price option when selecting “spot price.”
 

 Platform: Charge, Hub
 Audience: B2B and B2C (shared)

Description: An authentication method allowing users to access Monta with existing organizational or third-party credentials. 
 

 Usage rules:
 • On first mention write “Single Sign-On (SSO)”; use “SSO” thereafter.
 • Distinguish from MFA (additional factor) and password login.
 

 

 Platform: Hub
 Audience: B2B

Description: A fixed cost applied at the initiation of a charging session. Operators configure start fees within pricing to cover connection or transaction costs.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Distinguish from per-kWh, per-minute, or idle fees.
 • Used in the price group context, along 4 fee types in total: starting fee, charging fee, minute fee, and idle fee. 
 

 Platform: Hub, Charge
 Audience: B2B and B2C (shared)

Description: The exact moment a charging session begins or is scheduled to begin. Used for reporting, smart scheduling, and billing calculations.
 

 Platform: Hub, Charge
 Audience: B2B and B2C (shared)

Description: The current EV battery level expressed as a percentage of total capacity. Monta uses SoC to inform smart charging, session insights, and energy forecasting.
 

 Usage rules:
 • On first mention write “State of Charge (SoC)”; use “SoC” thereafter.
 • Use as a percentage (e.g., 20%, 80%); avoid kWh unless explicitly measured.
 • Distinguish from “target SoC” (desired level) and “range.”
 • Do not estimate SoC without a verified data source.
 

 Platform: Charge, Hub, Control
 Audience: B2B and B2C (shared)

Description: A financial summary in Monta that consolidates transactions, earnings, and withdrawals for a defined period. Used by operators and team owners for accounting and reconciliation.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Distinguish from “invoice” (bill) and “receipt” (proof of payment).
 

 Platform: Hub
 Audience: B2B

Description: The unique identifier assigned by Monta to a charge point for consistent tracking, reporting, and integrations. Used across hardware mappings, APIs, and operator networks.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Do not confuse with “serial number” (hardware) or “Meter ID.”
 • Do not modify, it’s a technical term. 
 • Source and target intact, do not translate. 
 

 Platform: Hub, Control
 Audience: B2B

Description: A physical label with a QR code on a charge point that lets drivers identify the device and start a session via Charge. May include charge point ID, operator logo, and quick-start steps.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Distinguish from “RFID card/key” and “Payment Terminal.”
 

 

 Platform: Charge, Hub
 Audience: B2B and B2C (shared)

Description: A sub-account is an operational account within an organization’s main account. It acts as an independent unit with its own users, teams, sites, and charging stations while remaining linked through the organization’s umbrella structure.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use “sub-account” in running text (lowercase, with hyphen). Capitalize only when it appears as a UI label, menu item, or title. 
 • Preferred article and plural: “a sub-account”; “sub-accounts.” Follow sentence case in body copy; use  
 

 Platform: Hub, Control 
 Audience: B2B

Description: Hub configurations that define how support is handled for a team, site, or partner (contacts, escalation, and system integrations). Streamlines routing and resolution.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Distinguish from “roles” (permissions) and “status page” (service health).
 

 Platform: Hub
 Audience: B2B

Description: A member role with permissions to assist users, monitor charge points, and handle inquiries with limited administration rights. 
 

 Usage rules:
 • Distinguish from “Manager” and “Owner” roles.
 

 

 Platform: Hub
 Audience: B2B

Description: Excess electricity—typically from on-site renewables—not immediately consumed. Used by solar surplus charging to power EVs, reducing grid import and waste.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Distinguish from “solar charging” (general) and “export” (to grid).
 

 Platform: Charge
 Audience: B2C

Description: CTA in Charge that lets a user start or stop a charging session by swiping to confirm. 
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use “swipe to start/stop” for action copy; avoid synonyms like “slide.”
 • Do not use for Hub actions.
 

 Platform: Charge
 Audience: B2C

Description: A structured pricing model that defines how charging costs are calculated (e.g., per kWh, per minute, idle or start fees). In Monta, tariffs can be fixed, spot-based (dynamic), or customized for specific user groups.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Distinguish from “price group” (configuration entity) and “master price” (base rate).
 

 Platform: Hub, Charge
 Audience: B2B and B2C (shared)

Description: US-centric, a tax authority identifier for individuals or businesses used for tax reporting purposes. European equivalent is VAT number.
 

 Usage rules:
 • On first mention, you may write “Tax Identification Number (Tax ID)” where needed.
 • Use country-specific names only when required (e.g., VAT number).
 

 Platform: Hub
 Audience: B2B

Description: An Italian tax identifier used exclusively for invoicing and fiscal reporting in Italy. In practice this is Codice Fiscale for individuals and Partita IVA for businesses.
 

 Usage rules:
 • In Italian-market UIs, use the legal terms Codice Fiscale (individual) and Partita IVA (business); do not invent alternative labels.
 • Do not confuse with non-Italian “Tax ID”. The term has no direct equivalent in other languages and should be translated literally in localized interfaces to maintain regulatory accuracy.
 

 Platform: Hub
 Audience: B2B

Description: A shared organizational unit that groups users under common wallets, sites, and permissions to manage charge points, access, pricing, and reporting. 4 team types: personal, private, professional, and operator.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use sentence case in running text and stand-alone UI labels. All other case, use lower case. 
 

 Platform: Hub, Charge
 Audience: B2B and B2C (shared)

Description: An owner of a shared organizational unit that groups users under common wallets, sites, and permissions to manage charge points, access, pricing, and reporting. 4 team types: personal, private, professional, and operator.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use sentence case in running text and stand-alone UI labels. All other case, use lower case. 
 

 Platform: Hub, Charge
 Audience: B2B and B2C (shared)

Description: A temporary reservation of funds on a customer’s payment card to confirm sufficient balance before the final charge amount is captured. Used during charging to validate payment; the hold is released or adjusted when the final amount is settled.  
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use lowercase: “temporary hold.” Acceptable variants in parentheses on first mention: “temporary hold (authorization hold or pre-authorization).”
 • Prefer “temporary hold” in customer-facing copy; use “authorization hold” in technical or payment settings.
 • Hyphenate “pre-authorization”; avoid “preauth,” “preauth hold,” or “deposit.”
 • Do not call it a “charge,” “payment,” or “fee.” If clarity is needed, use “not a charge” in explanatory text.
 

 Platform: Hub, Charge
 Audience: B2B and B2C

Description: The legally binding agreement that defines how users may access and use Monta’s products and services (Hub, Charge, Control), including rights, obligations, and limitations. 
 

 Usage rules:
 • Capitalize as a proper document title: “Terms and Conditions.”
 • In running text, use the definite article: “the Terms and Conditions.”
 • Do not abbreviate (avoid “T&Cs,” “T&C”).
 • Singular reference preferred (“The Terms and Conditions apply”); avoid treating it as a countable noun.
 • Do not use as a catch-all for policies; prefer “Privacy Policy,” “Cookie Policy,” or “Service Agreement” when those are meant.
 

 Platform: Hub, Charge, Control
 Audience: B2B and B2C

Description: The configurable visual style (e.g., colors, typography accents) applied in Charge or Hub to align with brand guidelines and improve usability.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Do not imply functional changes; theme affects appearance only.
 • Keep terminology consistent with design system tokens.
 

 Platform: Hub, Charge
 Audience: B2B and B2C (shared)

Description: A per-transaction cost applied to charging sessions or financial operations processed through Monta. Covers payment handling, processing, and platform service costs for operators and teams.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Distinguish from “start fee,” “idle fee,” and “service fee.”
 • Do not imply percentage vs fixed amount without stating it.
 

 Platform: Hub, Charge
 Audience: B2B and B2C (shared)

Description: An individual with a Monta account. Users can manage charging, access charge points, join teams, and handle payments based on assigned permissions.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Distinguish “user” (person) from “Member/Manager/Owner” (roles).
 • Avoid using “driver” unless specifically referring to B2C usage in Charge.
 • Us

Description: The permission level assigned to a user within a team or organization (e.g., Owner, Manager, Member, Supporter). Determines allowed actions across sites, wallets, and charge points.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Do not invent new role names; use the approved set.
 

 

 Platform: Hub
 Audience: B2B

Description: a percentage tax rate applied to the price of goods or services and shown on Monta invoices. It is relevant for EU transactions, including cross-border sales; in a U.S. context, the rough equivalent concept is “sales tax.”
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use “VAT” where it is the legal standard; do not mix with “sales tax” (U.S. concept).
 • Follow localization and fiscalization rules for wording, rounding, and export formats.
 

 Platform: Hub
 Audience: B2B

Description: A unique code assigned for businesses registered for Value Added Tax, used to identify taxable entities in EU and international trade. Typically formatted as an ISO country code (e.g., DK, DE, FR) followed by a numeric or alphanumeric sequence per local rules.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use the country-specific format and validate where possible (e.g., EU VIES); do not alter spacing or punctuation from the official input.
 • Do not confuse with the VAT rate or generic “Tax ID.”
 

 Platform: Hub
 Audience: B2B

Description: EU VAT term for transactions taxed at 0% (zero-rated) due to export rules. Although no VAT is charged, the sale must be shown on the invoice with the correct legal reference and included in VAT reports/exports.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Outside the EU, use a descriptive local equivalent; if required, add “zero-rated sales tax (EU VAT rules apply)” as an explanatory note.
 

 Platform: Hub
 Audience: B2B

translations.translation: zero-rated sales tax (EU VAT rules apply)
taxe de vente à taux zéro (règles de la TVA de l’UE applicables)

terms.description:
Description: A globally standardized unique code that identifies an individual vehicle and encodes manufacturer and build details (e.g., make, model, year, origin).
 

 Usage rules:
 • Write “VIN” in all caps; on first mention in long-form/regulatory text, use “Vehicle Identification Number (VIN).”
 • "VIN" is globally standardized and commonly used across languages. For clarity in long-form content, it can be spelled out with local translation
 

 

 Platform: Hub
 Audience: B2B

Description: Monta’s internal digital payment account for storing, managing, and transferring funds. Supports deposits, withdrawals, reimbursements, and automated payments for charging and subscriptions.
 

 Usage rules:
 • Use sentence case only in stand-alone UI labels and in the start of sentence, otherwise - lower case. 
 • Use “refill” for adding funds and “withdrawal” for moving funds out; avoid generic “top-up” if the UI uses “Refill.”
 • Avoid using “wallet” as a synonym for balance or invoice.
 

 Platform: Hub, Charge
 Audience: B2B and B2C (shared)

Description: Monta’s branding capability that lets partners run the platform under their own brand (logos, colors, custom domain), so end users see the partner’s identity across login, Hub, and user-facing links. 
 

 Usage rules:
 • Scope is branding and domains; it does not change core functionality, legal entities, or data ownership.
 

 Platform: Hub, Charge
 Audience: B2B
